recipe.name: Refried Beans
recipe.ingredients: Water to just below fill line (1800 grams or about 2 quarts) 225 grams (8 ounces) dried pinto beans 1 teaspoon salt (plus more, to taste) 1/4 teaspoon cumin 1/8 teaspoon garlic powder 2 tablespoons olive oil 1/2 teaspoon dried epazote

step.describe: Fill the bowl with water to about 1/2-inch below the maximum cooking line (about 1800 grams or 2 quarts)
Put the pinto beans into the cooking basket and insert the basket into the bowl.

Check the beans for tenderness. If you want a super-smooth puree, the beans need to be very soft, and almost mushy. If you want slightly chunkier refried beans, the beans should be cooked through, but not falling apart.
Remove the cooking basket from the bowl and discard all but 1 cup of the cooking liquid.
Put the beans back into the pot along with the reserved cooking water. Add the cumin, garlic powder, olive oil and epazote.
During 30 seconds, starting at speed 5 and slowly going up to speed 8
Taste the refried beans and add more salt or additional spices, if desired.
